topic.title: Do ZeroNet devs have a chat going on somewhere?
topic.body:
I enjoy communicating via ZeroTalk and ZeroMe posts, but I feel it would be rather efficient to get a real-time chat going on with ZeroNet devs and users.

The IRC channel is somewhat active but I never see @krixano or @GitCenter or others in there.

Do we already have an established chat somewhere? I remember the PeerMessage chat experiments, did those continue?

Ideally we'd use something p2p, but I'm down for using a federated solution such as [Matrix](https://matrix.org)/[Riot](https://riot.im/app).

1537880768_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5.body:
Hi, ZeroLSTN in mobile form with a temp username here.

I've thought about this. ZeroLSTN (and most sites) would be trivial to port to something like Electron. It would then be simple to have the Electron app use the ZeroNet daemon running on your computer.

As far as mobile devices go, Android/iOS now let you save a webpage to your homescreen and have it work like a website (Progress Web Apps I believe they're called). Not sure if those have any special OS level functionality though, I assume not.

But yes, wouldn't be too hard, and anyone could do it.

(P.S. I know ZeroLSTN really needs some love, but while I'm back on ZeroNet this time I've decided to focus on the pain points of ZeroNet, such as search engine ([Horizon](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HoRiznsHbJAqs2bmrVcSd79NTGVFp4Ju2/) is great btw), developer documentation and notifications).

> [thunder33345](#comment_230_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K): yes i think that could work but the idea that it would be more then just an iframementioning zerolstn since it is the only thing i could think of to get the MOST benefit from this, next to zerome and zeromail [...]

Yes one can easily just make a ZeroLSTN Android app and just load in the data from ZeroLSTN's merger sites.

This is of course a lot of extra work for someone, but if they're willing to go the extra distance then that's awesome.

Being able to port the app to Electron with as you say, removing the zero button and everything, would be nice though. I bet we could just create another URL prefix (such as the current raw one) for "single-site mode", which removes the floating button and sidebar. Then your electron app would point to:

http://localhost:43110/single/ZeroLSTN.bit

Btw, notifications can be done through web notifications. We could send a message through the ZeroFrame API to tell ZeroNet to send a notification that would be OS level (would appear at the side/corner in Windows/Mac/Linux, in notification bar on mobile, etc). I'm hoping to have ZeroHello do this actually.
